intro: Axinaea scutigera subsp. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorean axinaea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
